Name: Arab World Institute
Summary: (MF) History, ancient and medieval archeology, arts and crafts, ethnographic and contemporary art of the countries of the Arab world

Name: Archaeological Crypt of the Paris Notre-Dame
Summary: (VP) Remains under Notre Dame de Paris of buildings dating back to the city's early days

Name: Art Ludique
Summary: Exhibitions of contemporary art in comic books, manga, cinema, live animation and videogames

Name: Bibliothèque-Musée de l'Opéra National de Paris
Summary: Library and museum about the Paris Opera, part of the Music Department of the National Library of France

Name: Bibliothèque Polonaise de Paris
Summary: Includes three small museums about Polish natives: Musée Adam Mickiewicz about the poet, Musée Boleslas Biegas with paintings and sculpture by the artist and other Polish artists, and Salon Frédéric Chopin about the composer

Name: Cabinet des Médailles
Summary: Located in the Bibliothèque nationale de France, includes coins, medals, antiques from the ancient Near East, Greece, Rome, and national antiquities

Name: Catacombes de Paris
Summary: (VP) Underground ossuary with the remains of over six million people

Name: Cité de l'Architecture et du Patrimoine
Summary: Located in the Palais de Chaillot, includes Musée national des Monuments Français with plaster casts of French architecture, gallery of reproduced wall paintings and stained-glass windows from historic monuments, French and international architecture from 1850 to the present

Name: Cité des Sciences et de l'Industrie
Summary: Hands-on science exhibits, includes the French submarine Argonaute (S636)

Name: Cité nationale de l'histoire de l'immigration
Summary: (MF) History and culture of immigration in France from the 19th century to the present, located in the Palais de la Porte Dorée

Name: Espace Dalí
Summary: Life of and sculptures, engravings and paintings of Salvador Dalí

Name: Espace Fondation EDF
Summary: New media exhibitions and exhibitions about society and culture

Name: Fondation Cartier pour l'Art Contemporain
Summary: Contemporary art

Name: Fondation Custodia
Summary: Frits Lugt collection of European drawings, prints, paintings, books and artists' letters from the 15th to 19th century, focusing on Dutch and Flemish Old Masters, Italian and French artists

Name: Fondation Jean Dubuffet
Summary: Works by Jean Dubuffet, also main museum in Périgny, Val-de-Marne

Name: Fondation Louis Vuitton
Summary: Contemporary art

Name: Gaîté Lyrique
Summary: (VP premises) Digital art and culture center

Name: Galerie des Gobelins
Summary: Exhibitions of Gobelins tapestries

Name: Galerie nationale du Jeu de Paume
Summary: (MF) Modern and postmodern photography and media

Name: Galeries nationales du Grand Palais
Summary: Art exhibits and cultural events programmed by the Réunion des musées nationaux et du Grand Palais des Champs-Élysées

Name: Henri Cartier-Bresson Foundation
Summary: Archives and work of photographers Henri Cartier-Bresson and Martine Franck, exhibitions of other photographers, painters, sculptors, and illustrators

Name: Institut Tessin
Summary: Swedish art and culture

Name: Maison d'Auguste Comte
Summary: Restored 19th-century period rooms of positivist philosopher Auguste Comte (1798–1857), one of the 32 Maisons des illustres (fr) in the region Île de France

Name: Maison de Balzac
Summary: (VP) Restored 19th-century rooms with mementos of author novelist Honoré de Balzac

Name: Maison européenne de la photographie
Summary: (VP premises) Contemporary photography

Name: Maison de Victor Hugo
Summary: (VP) Restored 19th-century house of author novelist Victor Hugo

Name: Maison La Roche
Summary: Operated by Fondation Le Corbusier, 1920s house designed by Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret, exhibits art collection and archives of Le Corbusier

Name: Maxim's Art Nouveau "Collection 1900"
Summary: Art Nouveau objects and decor, located above Maxim's restaurant

Name: Mémorial de la Shoah
Summary: History of the Holocaust and French Jews in World War II

Name: Minerals collection of Pierre and Marie Curie University
Summary: 1500 minerals on display in 24 display cases

Name: Mona Bismarck American Center
Summary: Exhibitions of American art

Name: Mundolingua
Summary: Information, objects and documents relating to language, linguistic diversity and linguistics

Name: Musée – Librairie du Compagnonnage
Summary: History of French trade guilds, skilled craftsmen in fields such as cooking, pastry, plumbing, ironworks, masonry, cabinetmaking, carpentry

Name: Musée Adzak
Summary: Exhibits paintings, sculpture, and photography by a wide range of artists

Name: Musée "Bible et Terre Sainte"
Summary: Archaeological artifacts arranged to show everyday life in Palestine from 5000 BCE to 600 CE

Name: Musée Baccarat
Summary: Baccarat fine glass work, including vases, dishes and stemware, and limited-edition collections

Name: Musée Bourdelle
Summary: (VP) Sculptures, art and studio of Antoine Bourdelle

Name: Musée Carnavalet
Summary: (VP) City of Paris' history, culture, art, archaeology, decorative arts

Name: Musée Cernuschi
Summary: (VP) Asian art, specializing in works from China, Japan, and Korea

Name: Musée Clemenceau
Summary: Apartment and garden of Georges Clemenceau (1841–1929), French statesman and writer

Name: Musée Cognacq-Jay
Summary: (VP) 18th-century French fine and decorative art

Name: Musée Curie
Summary: History of radiology research and the work of Pierre and Marie Curie

Name: Musée d'Art Dentaire Pierre Fauchard
Summary: Dental history, tools and apparatus

Name: Musée d'Art et d'Histoire du Judaïsme
Summary: Jewish art and history, history of the Jews in France since the Middle Ages and in the communities of Europe and North Africa

Name: Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris
Summary: (VP) Modern and Contemporary art of the 20th and 21st centuries

Name: Musée d'Art Naïf – Max Fourny
Summary: (VP premises) Exhibitions of folk art, naive art, and outsider art

Name: Musée d'Ennery
Summary: Asian art with a focus on China and Japan

Name: Musée d'Histoire Contemporaine
Summary: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, exhibits of French and international history through its collections of art, photographs, posters, political cartoons and objects

Name: Musée d’histoire de la médecine
Summary: Located at the second floor of the Paris Descartes University, features historic medical instruments and apparatus

Name: Musée d'Orsay
Summary: Mainly French art dating from 1848 to 1914, including paintings, sculptures, furniture, and photography; houses the largest collection of Impressionist and post-Impressionist masterpieces in the world

Name: Musée de l'Armée
Summary: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, national military museum of France, includes Musée des Plans-Reliefs, weapons, uniforms, regalia, armor, artillery, Napoleon's Tomb

Name: Musée de l'Éventail
Summary: Hand fans and fan-making

Name: Musée des Archives Nationales
Summary: Exhibit of documents drawn from the Archives Nationales

Name: Musée de l'Homme
Summary: Human evolution and the history of human sciences

Name: Musée de l'Orangerie
Summary: Gallery of Impressionist and post-Impressionist paintings, features eight Water Lilies murals by Claude Monet

Name: Musée de l'Ordre de la Libération
Summary: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, history of the Free French Forces in World War II

Name: Musée de la Chasse et de la Nature
Summary: Sport of hunting, includes hunting weapons, accessories, trophies, art and decorative art, stuffed animal mounts

Name: Musée de la Contrefaçon
Summary: History of counterfeiting objects

Name: Musée de la Franc-Maçonnerie
Summary: History of Freemasonry in France, regalia, artifacts

Name: Musée de la Magie
Summary: Items relating to magic shows, including optical illusions, secret boxes, wind-up toys, magic mirrors, see-through glasses, posters, holds magic shows

Name: Musée de la Cinémathèque
Summary: Part of the Cinémathèque Française, history of film and pre-cinema in France and around the world

Name: Musée du 11 Conti - Monnaie de Paris
Summary: Part of the Monnaie de Paris. Heritage collections, workshops of excellence

Name: Musée de la Musique
Summary: Part of the Cité de la Musique, musical instruments, art

Name: Musée de La Poste
Summary: Postage stamps and postal history of France, currently closed for renovation

Name: Musée de la Sculpture en Plein Air
Summary: (VP) Outdoor sculptures from the second half of the twentieth century on display along the banks of the Seine

Name: Musée de la Vie Romantique
Summary: (VP) 19th house with Romantic-period art and decorative art, mementos of author George Sand

Name: Musée de Minéralogie
Summary: Minerals, rocks, ores, gems, artificial minerals

Name: Musée de Montmartre
Summary: (VP premises) Local history through paintings, photographs, posters and manuscripts

Name: Musée des Arts Décoratifs
Summary: Includes decorative arts (furniture, glass, ceramics and more), interior design, fashion, textiles, advertising, graphic arts

Name: Musée des Arts et Métiers
Summary: History of technology and industry, including advances in scientific instruments, materials, energy, mechanics, construction, communication and transport

Name: Musée des Arts Forains
Summary: Funfair objects including amusement rides, fair stalls and restored attractions, merry-go-rounds and carousels, German swings

Name: Musée des Collections Historiques de la Préfecture de Police
Summary: History of policing in France

Name: Musée des Égouts de Paris
Summary: (VP) History of tours of the Paris sewer system, role of sewer workers and methods of water treatment

Name: Musée des Lunettes et Lorgnettes Pierre Marly
Summary: History of eyewear, includes lorgnettes, glasses, telescopes, and binoculars

Name: Musée des moulages dermatologiques de l'hôpital Saint-Louis
Summary: Part of the historic building of the Hôpital Saint-Louis, features 19th-century wax casts of dermatological problems

Name: Musée des Plans-Reliefs
Summary: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, military models of fortified cities created between 1668 and 1870

Name: Musée du Barreau de Paris
Summary: History of the Paris Bar and its lawyers

Name: Musée du Fumeur
Summary: Includes smoking pipes, Egyptian sheeshas, snuffboxes, cigars, tobacco samples, hemp-fiber clothing, etchings, portraits, photographs, videos, and scientific drawings of tobacco plants

Name: Musée du Louvre
Summary: world's largest museum, includes paintings, prints and drawings, sculpture, decorative arts, Egyptian antiquities, Near Eastern antiquities, Greek, Etruscan and Roman antiquities, Islamic art

Name: Musée du Général Leclerc de Hauteclocque et de la Libération de Paris – Musée Jean Moulin
Summary: (VP) History of Maréchal Philippe Leclerc de Hauteclocque, Jean Moulin, a major figure of the French Resistance, and the liberation of Paris in World War II

Name: Musée du Luxembourg
Summary: Changing exhibitions of art

Name: Musée du Parfum Fragonard
Summary: History and process of perfume, antique perfume bottles, containers, toiletry sets, 19th-century period rooms

Name: Musée du quai Branly
Summary: Indigenous art and cultures of Africa, Asia, Oceania, and the Americas

Name: Musée du Service de Santé des Armées [fr]
Summary: History of medical care for armed services in France

Name: Musée du Service des Objets Trouvés
Summary: Items that have ended up in the Lost and Found department of the Paris Police

Name: Musée du Vin
Summary: History of the French craft of winemaking, includes tools and objects used to work the grapevine and the wine, a wine cellar, cooperage

Name: Musée Édith Piaf
Summary: Life of singer Édith Piaf

Name: Musée Edouard Branly
Summary: Life of radio pioneer Édouard Branly, includes his research laboratory and equipment, open by appointment

Name: Musée en Herbe
Summary: Art museum for children

Name: Musée Grévin
Summary: Scenes from the history of France and modern life

Name: Musée Jacquemart-André
Summary: 19th-century period house with major art collection

Name: Musée Maillol
Summary: Works by Aristide Maillol and art exhibitions

Name: Musée Marmottan Monet
Summary: Features over three hundred Impressionist and Post-Impressionist works by Claude Monet, other Impressionist and Post-Impressionist art, illuminated manuscripts, Napoleonic era art and furniture, Italian and Flemish primitive paintings

Name: Musée Moissan
Summary: Open by appointment, life of Henri Moissan (1852–1907), winner of the 1906 Nobel Prize in chemistry

Name: Musée National d'Art Moderne
Summary: Located at the Centre Georges-Pompidou, modern and contemporary art

Name: Musée national de la Légion d'Honneur et des Ordres de Chevalerie
Summary: History of France's honors, medals, decorations, and knightly orders from Louis XI to the present, including Napoleonic souvenirs and more than 300 portraits

Name: Musée national de la Marine
Summary: Includes ship model, maritime art, artifacts, photos

Name: Musée national des Arts asiatiques-Guimet
Summary: Asian art, also known as Musée Guimet

Name: Musée national du Moyen Âge
Summary: Formerly Musée de Cluny, Medieval art, houses six The Lady and the Unicorn tapestries, remnants of the third century Gallo-Roman baths

Name: Musée national Eugène Delacroix
Summary: Life and works of Eugène Delacroix

Name: Musée national Gustave Moreau
Summary: Home and studio of Symbolist painter Gustave Moreau (1826-1898)

Name: Musée national Jean-Jacques Henner
Summary: House and works of painter Jean-Jacques Henner (1829–1905)

Name: Musée Nissim de Camondo
Summary: Museum of French decorative arts displayed as in a wealthy private home

Name: Musée Pasteur
Summary: Life of scientist Louis Pasteur

Name: Musée Picasso
Summary: Life and work of artist Pablo Picasso, also works by Cézanne, Degas, Rousseau, Seurat, de Chirico and Matisse, Iberian bronzes, African art

Name: Musée Pierre Cardin
Summary: Over 250 Haute Couture designs from 1950 to 2000 designed by Pierre Cardin

Name: Musée Rodin
Summary: Works of the French sculptors Auguste Rodin and Camille Claudel, located in the Hôtel Biron

Name: Musée Valentin Haüy
Summary: History of the blind and of the methods that gave them access to culture

Name: Musée Yves Saint Laurent Paris
Summary: Opening in 2017, operated by the Fondation Pierre Bergé – Yves Saint Laurent, works by fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent

Name: Musée Zadkine
Summary: (VP) House and work of sculptor Ossip Zadkine (1890–1967)

Name: Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle
Summary: Includes galleries for minerals and gems, fossils and dinosaurs and comparative anatomy, and the Grand Gallery of Evolution

Name: Palais de la Découverte
Summary: Includes interactive exhibits for mathematics, physics, astronomy, chemistry, geology and biology

Name: Palais de Tokyo
Summary: Modern and contemporary art

Name: Palais Galliera
Summary: (VP) Also known as Musée de la Mode et du Costume de la Ville de Paris, fashion and fashion history, includes exhibits of French fashion design and costume from the eighteenth century to the present; closed between exhibitions

Name: Pavillon de l'Arsenal
Summary: (VP premises) Architecture and urban planning

Name: Pavillon de l'eau
Summary: (VP premises) History of the city's water supply

Name: Petit Musée de l'Argenterie
Summary: Decorative arts made of silver

Name: Petit Palais
Summary: (VP) Paintings, sculpture, Ancient Greek and Roman art, Renaissance art and artifacts, 17th, 18th and 19th century art and artifacts, art from the Western and Eastern Christian worlds, engravings and drawings, photography

Name: Salle des Traditions de la Garde Républicaine
Summary: History of the Garde Républicaine

Name: Tenniseum
Summary: Part of Roland Garros Stadium

Name: Théâtre-Musée des Capucines
Summary: Perfume

Name: Tour Jean-sans-Peur
Summary: History of the medieval tower and medieval Paris
